welcome_message_body: "Welcome to Pulheim, Germany! Known for its charming streets and rich history, we invite you to explore our beautiful city and take in all it has to offer. Enjoy your stay!"

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: The main terminal for domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: Primarily used for low-cost and charter flights.

wifi.note: Limited to 30 minutes per device per day.

terminals.name: Terminal A
terminals.description: The largest and main terminal at Düsseldorf International Airport, serving both domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal B
terminals.description: A smaller terminal at Düsseldorf International Airport, used mainly for low-cost and regional flights.

terminals.name: Terminal C
terminals.description: A modern terminal at Düsseldorf International Airport, primarily used for international flights.

wifi.note: Free and unlimited access for all passengers.

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: The main terminal at Moenchen-gl. - Dus Exp Airport.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: A smaller terminal used for domestic flights.

wifi.note: Free wifi is available throughout the airport.

terminals.name: Terminal A
terminals.description: The main terminal at Essen Airport, serving both domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal B
terminals.description: A smaller terminal at Essen Airport, mostly used for domestic flights within Germany.

wifi.note: Passengers can enjoy free WiFi throughout the airport for up to 2 hours.

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: The main terminal at Geilenkirchen Airport, serving both domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: A smaller terminal at Geilenkirchen Airport, primarily serving regional flights.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport.
